{{Infobox rail line |name = Circular Line (ç°çç·) |image = |caption = |type = [[Rapid transit]] |locale = [[Taipei]] and [[New Taipei]],
[[Republic of China]] ([[Taiwan]]) |start = |end = |stations = 32 |open = |operator = [[Taipei Rapid Transit System]] |character = Elevated and underground |depot = North Depot, South Depot |stock = Ansaldo STS |linelength = {{convert|35.2|km|mi|1|abbr=on}} |notrack = 2 |gauge = |speed = |el = |map = }} {{Chinese|t=ç°çç·|p=HuÃ¡nzhuÃ ng-XiÃ n|tp=HuÃ¡njhuÃ ng-SiÃ n|w=Huan2-chuang4 Hsien4|poj=KhoÃ¢n-chÅng-SÃ²aâ¿}} The [[Taipei Rapid Transit System|Taipei Metro]] '''Circular Line''' ({{zh|t=ç°çç·}}) is an elevated, [[Medium-capacity rail transport system|medium-capacity]] [[rapid transit]] in [[Taipei]] and [[New Taipei]], [[Taiwan]]. It is currently under construction with the first section scheduled to open in 2015. Stage I construction consists of the section from Wugu Industrial District to [[Dapinglin Station|Dapinglin]] on the [[Xindian Line (TRTS)|Xindian Line]] and will be about {{convert|15.4|km|mi|abbr=on}} long with 14 stations.{{cite web|url=http://www.dorts.gov.tw/english/Network/frame_stage2.htm|title=Second Stage of Taipei MRT (Approved MRT Line)|publisher=Comprehensive Planning Division|date=2009-07-04|accessdate=2009-08-14}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} The north and south sections of the Circle Line are considered separate projects and will be proposed to the Ministry of Transportation and Communications. ==Construction== [[Ansaldo STS]] will supply electromechanical equipment for the line, including driverless technology and CBTC Radio signalling.{{cite web|url=http://www.railwaygazette.com/news/single-view/view//taipei-circular-line-kicks-off.html|title=Taipei Circular Line kicks off|publisher=Railway Gazette|date=2009-03-17|accessdate=2010-02-07}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} [[Dapinglin Station]], the only underground station on the line, is being constructed by RSEA Engineering Corporation and will employ the [[Tunnel#Cut-and-cover|cut-and-cover]] method.{{cite web|url=http://english.dorts.taipei.gov.tw/ct.asp?xItem=1078943&ctNode=15933&mp=115002|title=Part of Circular Line Phase I Construction Successfully Awarded and Main Construction to be Launched|publisher=Department of Rapid Transit Systems|date=2009-12-23|accessdate=2010-02-22}} Construction officially broke ground on July 11, 2011 on a {{convert|6.3|km|mi|abbr=on}} elevated section between [[Zhonghe District|Zhonghe]] and [[Banqiao District|Banqiao]].{{cite news|url=http://news.cens.com/cens/html/en/news/news_inner_36893.html|title=Construction on 1st-Stage Ring Section of Taipei MRT Breaks Ground|publisher=China Economic News Service|date=2011-07-12|accessdate=2011-07-14}} The section is estimated to cost [[New Taiwan dollar|NT$]]13.7 billion, with the entire first-stage {{convert|15.4|km|mi|abbr=on}} route estimated to cost NT$54.7 billion to construct. The line will include the first elevated [[split platform]] in the system at Huazhong Bridge, Qiaohe, and Zhongyuan Stations due to narrowness of the available station area.{{cite web|url=http://www2.dorts.gov.tw/news/newsletter/ns280/280-01.htm|title=Construction of the Circular Line Launched|publisher=Department of Rapid Transit Systems|date=2011-06-01|accessdate=2011-07-22}}{{cite web|url=http://www.edpo.dorts.gov.tw/public/Data/152414345471.pdf|title=ç°çç·CF650æ¨é«æ¶æ®µéå·¥äº|publisher=Department of Rapid Transit Systems|date=2011-05-01|accessdate=2011-07-25}} ==Stations== {|class=wikitable !rowspan=2|Code!!rowspan=2|Section
